page.title: 01Egilsy Rousay Sound
page.content: Egilsy, Rousay Sound & East Rousay Holm of Scockkness is a small island lying the north of the souund which is uninhabited though used for grazing. There are several arams on the Rousy Coastal strip ndd a one time mill now converted to a dwelling house. Scallops,lobsters,and crab are fished in the sound.A twice weekly ferry from the Orkney mainland runs via Rousayy to the west side of Egilsay. All the dwellings on Egibay apart from the school house are farms St Magnus Church and Monument are of historical interest. The cliffs on the north coast of the island are home for several species of bird and there is an bundance of wild flowers.
